Wisdom: الْمُرُوءَةُ اسْمٌ جَامِعٌ لِسَائِرِ الْفَضَائِلِ وَالْمَحَاسِنِ
enWisdom: Magnanimity is a title that encompasses all the [other] merits and virtues

Wisdom: لَوْ أَنَّ الْمُرُوءَةَ لَمْ تَشْتَدَّ مَئُونَتُهَا وَيَثْقُلْ مَحْمِلُهَا مَا تَرَكَ اللِّئَامُ الْأَغْمَارُ مِنْهَا مَبِيتَ لَيْلَةٍ وَلَكِنَّهَا اشْتَدَّتْ مَئُونَتُهَا وَثَقُلَ مَحْمِلُهَا فَحَادَ عَنْهَا اللِّئَامُ الْأَغْمَارُ وَحَمَلَهَا الْكِرَامُ الْأَخْيَارُ
enWisdom: If magnanimity was not difficult to acquire and heavy to bear, the wicked and ignorant ones would not have left from it anything even for a single night, but its acquisition is difficult and its burden is heavy, so the wicked and ignorant turned away from it and the honourable and virtuous ones adopted it

Wisdom: مِنْ أَفْضَلِ الدِّينِ الْمُرُوءَةُ وَلَا خَيْرَ فِي دِينٍ لَيْسَ لَهُ مُرُوَّةٌ
enWisdom: Magnanimity is one of the most excellent religious teachings and there is no good in a religion which has no magnanimity in it

Wisdom: مَا حَمَلَ الرَّجُلُ [الرِّجَالُ‏] حِمْلًا أَثْقَلَ مِنَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
enWisdom: Nobody has carried a burden heavier than magnanimity
The distinguishing feature of a man is his intellect and his beauty is his magnanimity
The magnanimity of a person is to the extent of his intellect
